title: Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder
name: ServiceBuilder
description:
Google Cloud Platform is a set of modular cloud-based services that allow you to create anything from simple websites to complex applications.

This API aims to expose access to these services in a way that is intuitive and easy to use for PHP enthusiasts. The ServiceBuilder instance exposes factory methods which grant access to the various services contained within the API.

Configuration is simple. Pass in an array of configuration options to the constructor up front which can be shared between clients or specify the options for the specific services you wish to access, e.g. Datastore, or Storage.

Please note that unless otherwise noted the examples below take advantage of Application Default Credentials.

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Pass in an array of configuration options which will be shared between clients.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

methods.name: bigQuery
methods.description: Google Cloud BigQuery allows you to create, manage, share and query data. Find more information at the Google Cloud BigQuery Docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the other available options.

params.name: config.returnInt64AsObject
params.description: If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility. Defaults to false.

methods.name: datastore
methods.description: Google Cloud Datastore is a highly-scalable NoSQL database for your applications. Find more information at the Google Cloud Datastore docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the other available options.

params.name: config.returnInt64AsObject
params.description: If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility. Defaults to false

methods.name: logging
methods.description: Google Stackdriver Logging allows you to store, search, analyze, monitor, and alert on log data and events from Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services. Find more information at the Google Stackdriver Logging docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the available options.

methods.name: language
methods.description: Google Cloud Natural Language provides natural language understanding technologies to developers, including sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and syntax analysis. Currently only English, Spanish, and Japanese textual context are supported. Find more information at the Google Cloud Natural Language docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the available options.

methods.name: pubsub
methods.description: Google Cloud Pub/Sub allows you to send and receive messages between independent applications. Find more information at the Google Cloud Pub/Sub docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the other available options.

params.name: config.transport
params.description: The transport type used for requests. May be either grpc or rest. Defaults to grpc if gRPC support is detected on the system

methods.name: spanner
methods.description: Google Cloud Spanner is a highly scalable, transactional, managed, NewSQL database service. Find more information at Google Cloud Spanner API docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the other available options.

params.name: config.returnInt64AsObject
params.description: If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility. Defaults to false.

methods.name: speech
methods.description: Google Cloud Speech enables easy integration of Google speech recognition technologies into developer applications. Send audio and receive a text transcription from the Cloud Speech API service. Find more information at the Google Cloud Speech API docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the other available options.

params.name: config.languageCode
params.description: The language of the content to be recognized. Only BCP-47 (e.g., "en-US", "es-ES") language codes are accepted. See Language Support for a list of the currently supported language codes

methods.name: storage
methods.description: Google Cloud Storage allows you to store and retrieve data on Google's infrastructure. Find more information at the Google Cloud Storage API docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the available options.

methods.name: trace
methods.description: Google Stackdriver Trace allows you to collect latency data from your applications and display it in the Google Cloud Platform Console. Find more information at Stackdriver Trace API docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the available options.

methods.name: vision
methods.description:
Google Cloud Vision allows you to understand the content of an image, classify images into categories, detect text, objects, faces and more.

Find more information at the Google Cloud Vision docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options. See Google\Cloud\ServiceBuilder::__construct() for the available options.

methods.name: translate
methods.description:
Google Cloud Translation provides the ability to dynamically translate text between thousands of language pairs and lets websites and programs integrate with translation service programmatically.

The Google Cloud Translation API is available as a paid service. See the Pricing and FAQ pages for details. Find more information at the the Google Cloud Translation docs.

Please note that while the Google Cloud Translation API supports authentication via service account and application default credentials like other Cloud Platform APIs, it also supports authentication via a public API access key. If you wish to authenticate using an API key, follow the before you begin instructions to learn how to generate a key.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: config.key
params.description: A public API access key.

params.name: config.target
params.description: The target language to assign to the client. Defaults to en (English).

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.
